title: The listener: love of money and how it affects people’s life especially in decision making and personality
abstract: My screenplay The Listener is the story of Mike, a guy in his late 20s who loves money and thinks that money can buy happiness. My work’s main idea revolves around loves of money and how it can lead to a bad decision. I used the theory Base of Materialism Theory from Belk to construct the personalities of the main character. I used crime as the genre and Heist Flicks as the subgenre. This genre is a suitable genre because I see a lot of similarities and genre convention with my screenplay’s subject matter of loves of money and money cannot buy someone’s happiness. The story mostly tells about how Mike faces hardship in making decisions due to his loves of money. Later, he focuses on his prestige by having lots of money. In the end, he realizes that friendship is more important than money.
